intro: Comesperma aemulum, commonly known as the slender comesperma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia, where it typically grows in coastal heathlands and sand dunes. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, woody fruits. It is an important component of the local flora and provides habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
